etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 拉(拉) (lā, "to pull") = mouth forming sound + phonetic 拉 -> horn sound
etymology.interpretation: The character 喇 combines 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth"), representing the sound produced, with the phonetic 拉(拉) (lā, "to pull"), suggesting the action required to produce a horn's sound. This effectively conveys the sound of a horn or trumpet.

examples.chinese: 当喇响起时(當喇響起時)，士兵们迅速集合(士兵們迅速集合)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng lǎ xiǎngqǐ shí, shìbīng men xùnsù jíhé.
examples.english: When the horn sounds, the soldiers quickly assemble.

examples.chinese: 他们在庆典上吹奏喇(他們在慶典上吹奏喇)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zài qìngdiǎn shàng chuīzòu lǎ.
examples.english: They play the horn at the celebration.

examples.chinese: 传令员吹响喇(傳令員吹響喇)，驱散敌人(驅散敵人)。
examples.english: The herald blows the horn, driving away the enemy.
